channel.title: HSE University on Leonid Gremyachikh
channel.description: Recent content in HSE University on Leonid Gremyachikh

item.title: Interview: a short interview with me on the HSE university website
item.description: An interview with me on the HSE website has been published. I told why and how I came to be in data science, as well as about graduate school. https://cs.hse.ru/news/741609195.html

item.title: School: summer school on entrepreneurship (Faculty of Computer Science, HSE University)
item.description: Attended the HSE university’s summer school, August 22-26, 2022. Wonderful and realistically-sincere event. It was most interesting to get to know the participants and speakers, and the following topics: networking search for investment startup economics Full program.

item.title: Space Navigator
item.description: TL; DR A system for calculating optimal collision avoidance maneuvers for satellites based on reinforcement learning. About We made Space Navigator - a system for automatically determining the probability of collision of space objects and calculating the most effective evasive maneuver using AI. Stage of the project: Research Article “Space Navigator: a Tool for the Optimization of Collision Avoidance Maneuvers” (2020) MVP (2019) First place in the competition of projects of the Academy of Roscosmos (presentation slides, 2018) VR presentation (2018) Demonstrations and reports:

item.title: Storage Digital Twin
item.description: TL; DR Digital Twin of the Data Storage System based on conditional generative models. Photo by benjamin lehman on Unsplash My role Generative models research

item.title: ML-IDS
item.description: TL; DR A course on machine learning for scientists “Machine Intelligence, interdisciplinary perspective”. Platform: https://en.pelican.study/. My role Lectures and homeworks (python, pytorch-lightning) topics: Deep Learning foundations: Convolutional Neural Network, BatchNorm, etc. Computer Vision foundations: Image Classification, Transfer Learning, etc. AutoEncoders Normalizing Flows Anomaly detection Time series

item.title: Anomaly Prediction
item.description: TL; DR Application of Neural Networks, Machine Learning algorithms, Reinforcement Learning and Natural Language Processing for Detection / Prediction of Anomalies in Storage Area Network by log data. Also, development and testing researched methods for improving Digital Twin of Storage Area Network, methods on chaotic systems, OpenAI Gym wrappers. Research Article “Online detection of failures generated by storage simulator” (2021) Research Article “SANgo: a storage infrastructure simulator with reinforcement learning support” (2020) Experiments and intermediate results Photo by Denny Müller on Unsplash

item.title: Satellite Positioning
item.description: TL; DR Improving the prediction of the position of a space object using machine learning. About The project task – build a model that would predict the position of space objects using simulation data. https://www.esa.int/Applications/Telecommunications_Integrated_Applications/Orbits Predicting the position of satellites is one of the most important tasks in astronomy. For example, information on the exact position of satellites in orbit is necessary to avoid extremely dangerous satellite collisions.

item.title: Speech: SMILES (ML school at Skoltech)
item.description: Participated in the international summer school SMILES – The Summer School of Machine Learning at Skoltech from 16 to 21 August 2020. In the poster session, I talked about two “AI & Satellite Problems” projects that we were engaged at the Laboratory of Methods for Big Data Analysis at the National Research University Higher School of Economics. Below is the submitted poster and the certificate provide. Poster PDF Certificate PDF Post about Data Analysis for Satellite Tracking
